job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: <p>Modis has partnered with a unique company located in the Seattle, WA area to help find an experienced Software Engineer. The Client is a GIS software and services firm, and they create custom applications for both the web as well as distributed and scalable workflow applications. Many of their applications rely on specialty GIS/mapping software, especially from the MapInfo family of products.</p><p><br></p><p>As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for creating custom web and desktop applications in a collaborative team environment, writing mostly in <strong><u>C# and Javascript/Typescript</u></strong> and using numerous third party packages including cartographic and database tools. About 80% of your time will be spent creating features - planning, research, writing code (including unit tests), and reviewing. You will also support the Operations team in their work on acceptance testing, deployment, and technical support. The other 20% of your time will be spent on agile process meetings including daily standups, ad hoc planning meetings, biweekly retrospectives, lunch and learn events, and staff meetings.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Skills You Will Use:</u></strong></p><p><br></p><p><em>TECHNICAL</em></p><p><br></p><p> 4+ years of professional software engineering/development experience</p><p> Write front and back-end code with unit tests.</p><p> Model solutions to geometric, cartographic, and statistical problems.</p><p> Solve bugs efficiently.</p><p> Take unfamiliar code and figure out what it is doing.</p><p> Create complex SQL queries and analyze indexing for performance.</p><p> Ability to quickly learn new software and technical skills</p><p> Ability to research and troubleshoot technical issues</p><p> Ability to follow and understand a complex distributed algorithm</p><p><br></p><p><em>SOCIAL/COOPERATIVE</em></p><p><br></p><p> Strong written and oral communication skills</p><p> Collaborative approach with team members</p><p> Ability to prioritize and shift smoothly between tasks</p><p> Resolve interpersonal conflicts professionally</p><p> Ability to accept and offer constructive feedback</p><p> Willingness to ask for and offer help as needed</p><p> Willingness to take ownership of responsibilities and decisions</p><p> Active engagement with commitment to helping create an inclusive workplace.</p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Benefits:</u></strong></p><p><br></p><p> a comprehensive health insurance plan</p><p> company matching 401K retirement plan</p><p> standard business holidays (including your birthday)</p><p> sick and safe time exceeding the requirements of Seattle law</p><p> vacation time starting at 10 days per year and increasing to a maximum of 17 days per year</p><p> a yearly profit-sharing bonus</p><p> optional 40 hours paid volunteer time</p><p> annual COLA salary adjustments</p><p> Monthly “opposite” days to pursue innovation ideas and present to the team.</p>
